revised_title: Walter Stiles: A Pioneering Botanist and Plant Physiologist
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Biology
tldr: Walter Stiles was a distinguished botanist and plant physiologist who made significant contributions to the fields of plant anatomy, permeability, and plant tissue studies. His work focused on understanding the entry of salts into plant tissues and the effects of temperature and organic substances on permeability. Stiles also conducted research on the preservation of food by freezing and cool storage of fruits. Throughout his career, he collaborated with several notable scientists, including Ingvar Jorgensen and J.H. Priestley.
